column4: I'm having an issue with a usb-vga graphics connection in 12.10 and was wondering if anyone would be able to help?
does it show in the output of:  sudo lshw -C display
no. but it is identified for lsusb
much of the issue is summarized here https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/1050566, but it stands unresolved
cool, any results online for the 8 character hex ID?
One point that I noted in the bug report was that the ID needed to be added to the driver table under sisusb_table, but I'm not sure how that is done. Any ideas?
seems to use the sisusbvga driver
you may need an xorg.conf to make it fly
That was alluded to in much older versions (circa 9.10) with the same issue but figured enough of xorg had updated through 12.10 for that to not be necessary.
I'll give it a try. Just as a refresh xorg conf should go in the dir /etc/x11/xorg.conf?
xorg.conf can be necessary, if one xists it wil be obeyed
Sounds good. Thank you for your time.
could you elaborate? Is there something related to lenovo drivers?
i was just going to suggest a PCI video card if the system was a desktop
